Description: Sherd of East Greek pottery plate, preserving profile; low ring foot, groove at inner edge of rim; white slip on inside; glaze fired brown or orange; hook maeander banmd on top of rim, outside and underside glazed; lotus bud anf flower frieze at outside of floor; three bands towards cantre and traces of tondo decoration; exterior; two bands on wall, foot perhaps wholly glazed (much worn). Part of one suspension hole through rim.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1166)
